Engineering with passion, designing with purpose.
My background and the values I cherish.
About.name: Haruto Fujimoto
About.profile: I am a university student majoring in Information Engineering at Ibaraki University, aspiring to be a Full Stack Engineer. I dove into the world of programming upon entering university in 2023. Initially starting with a simple interest in 'making things work', through hackathons, internships, and personal projects, I awakened to the joy of 'solving someone's problems with technology' and 'providing new value experiences'. Currently, I am focusing on application development using Generative AI and modern frontend development using React/Next.js. In my university lab, I am also exploring 'AI x SE (Software Engineering)' to search for higher quality and more efficient system development methods.

Interested in my experience and skills?
Feel free to contact me for work requests or technical discussions.

t4.description: Developed an 'Automatic Schedule Extraction App from Emails' in a team. Demonstrated short-term problem-solving skills and practical skills in incorporating Generative AI into products.

t5.description: Interested in 'AI x SE' and 'Simulation Technology', started research on software development and information management. Redefining own development experience from an engineering perspective and exploring high-quality system construction.

v1.title: User Centric
v1.subtitle: Empathy for Users
v1.description: 'Does it move the user's heart?' Technology is just a means, the goal is to solve user problems and improve experiences. I value emotional value that makes users feel 'comfortable' or 'interesting' the moment they touch it, not just logical function implementation.

v2.title: Borderless Curiosity
v2.subtitle: No Boundaries
v2.description: 'Don't limit the domain' Web frontend, backend, AI, and 3D expression. I greedily absorb new technologies according to what I want to make without staying in a specific technical area, and create new value by combining them.

v3.title: Professional Ownership
v3.subtitle: Responsibility for Details
v3.description: 'Stick to the last 1px' From personal development to team development and internships, I ask myself 'Is this quality I can be proud of as a professional?' instead of 'It's fine if it works'. I believe that attention to detail, from code readability to UI behavior, determines the overall quality.

Projects.title: Selected Works
Projects.subtitle:
From personal exploration to team problem solving.
Here are some projects I've built using technology.

PortfolioSite.description: A portfolio site with a 'Growth and Connection' concept. Features a RAG chatbot (Haru-AI) built with Dify for interactive experiences.
PortfolioSite.fullDescription: A portfolio site optimized for SEO and performance using Next.js 14 App Router. Designed with a 'Museum/Gallery' theme, aiming for a minimal and sophisticated UI that highlights the works. Integrated with an AI chatbot trained on my personal data to provide interactive information.

process.challenge: Static portfolio sites often fail to answer specific visitor questions immediately, leading to lost opportunities.
process.solution: Implemented a RAG chatbot using Dify. Turned my resume and project info into a knowledge base to generate accurate, context-aware answers.
process.outcome: Increased visitor engagement time and improved accuracy in answering technical questions, allowing for deeper self-promotion.

InvestInMe.description: Portfolio management app for individual investors. Visualizes asset trends with intuitive UI to support investment decisions.
InvestInMe.fullDescription: A web application for individual investors with multiple brokerage accounts to manage assets centrally. Features real-time graph visualization of daily asset trends and portfolio balance analysis.

process.challenge: Performance degradation due to re-rendering when processing large amounts of transaction data on the client side.
process.solution: Implemented memoization with React.memo and offloaded calculations to Web Workers. Optimized Recharts settings for smooth rendering.
process.outcome: Achieved smooth operation at 60fps even with graphs containing thousands of data points, significantly improving UX.

MailDeCalen.description: AI schedule management assistant linking Gmail and Google Calendar. Gemini AI analyzes emails and automatically registers events.
MailDeCalen.fullDescription: A hackathon product aiming to 'eliminate the hassle of scheduling via email'. AI analyzes received emails, extracts date, time, place, and participants, and tentatively registers them to Google Calendar.

keyFeatures.f1: High-precision Entity Extraction with Gemini Pro

process.challenge: Extracting accurate date and time from unstructured email text was difficult with traditional regex approaches.
process.solution: Utilized Gemini Pro API with Few-shot prompting to improve accuracy. Outputted results as structured data (JSON) for stable processing.
process.outcome: Successfully extracted schedule information with over 90% accuracy even from complex emails, leading to a hackathon award.

Nazomi.description: Anonymous diary matching service. Uses NLP for sentiment analysis to match users with high empathy.
Nazomi.fullDescription: A mental health care app to relieve loneliness in modern society. Users write anonymous diaries, AI analyzes emotions, and matches users with similar feelings for temporary chat.

process.challenge: Minimizing server load and message latency in real-time chat implementation.
process.solution: Built an asynchronous chat server using FastAPI and WebSocket. Introduced Redis as a Pub/Sub messaging layer for scalability.
process.outcome: Achieved low-latency messaging even with 100 concurrent connections, providing a smooth communication environment.

StampRallyMap.description: Stamp rally app for promoting local tourism. Uses Google Maps API to award stamps when reaching specific spots.
StampRallyMap.fullDescription: A web app developed as a university team project for regional revitalization. Users get stamps when approaching spots using GPS. Stamps are original AI-generated images using Stable Diffusion.

keyFeatures.f1: Map Display with Google Maps API

process.challenge: UX issues where stamps couldn't be obtained even at the spot due to GPS accuracy variations.
process.solution: Improved detection logic by adding buffers to circular areas and allowing manual location updates. Added visual feedback UI during detection.
process.outcome: Users could enjoy the stamp rally without stress in field tests, improving the completion rate.
